page.title: 19GUID NYCHBURRIS (cont)
page.content: {THE MARCHES:}are the boundaries of the town over which the Provost and Magistrates have jurisdiction. "Stobbing and nogging" means marking those boundaries with posts and flags. THE CORNET: would have been a cavalry officer. {7.35 am } Courier rides to town and demands admission at Tounheid Port. {7.50}He is taken to meet Provost. {7.50}Cornet assembles his followers in High Street. {8.00}Cornet and Pursuivant ride out to meet each other. {8.10}Meet on Edinburgh Road, he points out the march,and 4 Lynors mark it by stob and nog. {8.25}They arrive at War Memorial to lay a wreath, then onward to Tounheid Port. {8.35}They arrive at the Lochmabengate Port.
